title: Understanding File Formats
text: A .csv file is a type of file that stores data in a tabular format, plain text form. It is commonly used for transferring simple data sets between programs.

title: Explore the Import Feature
text: In Google Sheets, the import feature lets you bring data from external sources into your spreadsheet. This function is essential for adding new information without manually copying and pasting.

title: Insert or Import Location
text: When importing a .csv file, think about where this new data should appear. Consider using the 'Insert New Sheet' under the import location to add new data into the spreadsheet.

title: Maintaining Organized Sheets
text: For clarity and better management of data, adding the .csv data as a new sheet is an effective approach. This keeps your current data separate from the newly imported information.

hintAnswer: Select "Insert New Sheet" under Import location when you import the .csv file.
title: Steps to Take When Importing
text: Here is what you should do: $$1$$. Go to File -> Import. $$2$$. Select the .csv file you want to import. $$3$$. Choose 'Insert New Sheet' when asked about import location.
choices: Paste the .csv data into a new sheet in your Google Sheets spreadsheet.
Upload the .csv file as a separate file, then move it to your existing Google Sheets spreadsheet.
Select "Insert New Sheet" under Import location when you import the .csv file.
